15:17PM 51721589576675629521701895@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi, what is the benefit to listing my dissertation in ProQuest?15:17PM 51721589576675629521701895@web.libraryh3lp.com: it seems to only, potentially, restrict rights15:17PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Others who have access to the database will be able to search by subject, author, keywords, etc. and locate it.15:17PM 51721589576675629521701895@web.libraryh3lp.com: it's CMU Research Showcase + making available on the internet probably "good enough" ?15:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: that's up to you. I'll send you a link with info that may help15:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: http://www.library.cmu.edu/datapub/sc/dissertation/decisions15:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Do you want people to discover your dissertation when they search the open web using an Internet search engine such as Google, or do you prefer that discovery of your work be more restricted, for example, via a search of a library catalog, Dissertation Abstracts International, or the Dissertations & Theses Database? If you want to encourage easy discovery by the broadest possible range of readers, then enable your work to be discovered in a search of the open web.If you publish your dissertation with the University Libraries, i.e., deposit it in Research Showcase, your work will be discoverable in a search of the open web. ProQuest/UMI will make your work discoverable via a search of the open web if you request this option. (See page 4 of the ProQuest Publishing Agreement.) However, dissertations in Research Showcase are more easily discovered in an Internet search than those in the ProQuest database.15:19PM 51721589576675629521701895@web.libraryh3lp.com: ok, thanks!15:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You're welcome!

Albert Juszczak, Ph.D.08:07AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi08:09AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Anyone may come into our library between the hours of 8am and midnight to use the facilities. 11:31AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Why can't I open full articles. It just gives me this abstract and full text of that article's abstract.11:32AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: because there's no fulltext?11:32AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: how are you accessing it?11:32AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: through a database? through a website?11:33AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: I search the article through the search engine in the website. It gives me these links. I open one of them. And it gives me these links to open the article11:33AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: I open that article and it just gives me the abstract 11:33AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Where is the link to the full article 11:33AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: can you give me the title? so I can check?11:34AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Public Opinion on US Airlines on Social Media11:35AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: which link are you clicking .. the one that says Article? 11:35AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yea11:35AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: This is a short article 222 words11:35AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: did you click on the last one (from ProQuest?)11:36AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yea11:36AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: well it should lead you to the article 11:36AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Full Text    Translate Full text2012 JAN 29 - (VerticalNews.com) -- Research and Markets (http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/c24c77/public_opinion_on) has announced the addition of the "Public Opinion on US Airlines on Social Media" report to their offering.What are consumers saying about US airlines on social media?Find out in Amplicate's new report 'Public Opinion on US Airlines on Social Media' that tells you what consumers have been saying about airlines on social media in the last 12 months, when and where they're posting their opinions and why.The report is full of charts, detailed data descriptions and straightforward analysis of the most interesting data points and is packed with hard data that is easy to understand and easy to act on.PUBLICATION OVERVIEWThis report offers analytics on opinions about US airlines that were posted by consumers on social media in the last 12 months. Social media users posted more negative opinions than positive about US airlines in the last 12 months. The report shows why social media users were negative about US airlines in the last 12 months. The report also provides a profile of the social media user who talks about US airlines and contains data on when and where they share their opinion.Keywords: Transportation.This article was prepared by Transportation Business Journal editors from staff and other reports. Copyright 2012, Transportation Business Journal via VerticalNews.com.Word count: 222Copyright 2012, Transportation Business Journal via NewsRx.com11:37AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yea so its like the abstract right?11:37AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: no .. that's the article .. a short article11:37AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Its a short article about a bigger article 11:37AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com:  Find out in Amplicate's new report 'Public Opinion on US Airlines on Social Media' that tells you what consumers have been saying about airlines on social media in the last 12 months, when and where they're posting their opinions and why11:38AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: What does this mean?11:38AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Where is this report?11:40AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: you have to buy those11:40AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: talk to the business librarian?  which department do you do?11:40AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Information Systems11:42AM 00574936464853321665645166@web.libraryh3lp.com: Okay. 15:23PM 25601143358117305068210905@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hello, I have a question regarding putting course materials on reserve15:23PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi15:24PM 25601143358117305068210905@web.libraryh3lp.com: If a book is listed in "Arts Reference" up on the 4th Fl does that mean this is essentially already "on reserve" and cannot be checked out?15:25PM 25601143358117305068210905@web.libraryh3lp.com: http://search.library.cmu.edu/vufind/Record/144037415:26PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Arts reference books are books that cannot be checked out without permission from a reference librarian.  so in some way they are on reserve, i.e. need special permission to be checked out.  Unfortunately no arts reference librarians are on chat, so if you want to pursue this further with them, you can send email to artsref@andrew.cmu.edu.  One thing different about books on reserve vs. reference15:26PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: is that reference books are on open shelves, and anyone can take them anywhere in the library.15:26PM 25601143358117305068210905@web.libraryh3lp.com: ok great, I will reach out to them thanks!15:27PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: When books are on reserve, they are  kept at the Circ desk and students have to sign them out with their CMU IDs, so there is more accountability.15:28PM 25601143358117305068210905@web.libraryh3lp.com: can reference books be placed on reserve?15:28PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: The arts librarian is Mo Dawley, md2Z@andrew.cmu.edu if you want to contact her directly.15:28PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I believe so, but you may want to talk with Mo directly.15:29PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You could also just fill out the form, and if there is a problem, the reserves associate will contact you.15:32PM 25601143358117305068210905@web.libraryh3lp.com: ok great, thanks15:33PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You're welcome!

12:58PM 89054923290093542788026015@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hello,   one of the Heinz college faculty is trying to access the Web of Science while abroad.  Is this possible without a VPN?12:58PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi12:58PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Yes.12:59PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If he goes to the Libraries' homepage www.library.cmu.edu and goes to Research Databases (under the search box) and also under "Search and Find"12:59PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Go to W for web of science.  He'll be prompted for his Andrew user ID and psswd13:00PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: This is true for 99.99% of our databases-those that need the VPN have that info in the database description.13:01PM 89054923290093542788026015@web.libraryh3lp.com: Ok.  and using that portal will avoid the issues he had with 'roaming' while trying to access it from abroad?13:01PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I'm not sure what you mean by "issues with roaming."13:02PM 89054923290093542788026015@web.libraryh3lp.com: When he attempted to login in with his Web of Science id and password, he was told he had not accessed it from his network and therefore had no access to 'roaming'13:05PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Sorry, I don't know what that means.  All I know is that our databases are fit with a proxy that lets you login from anywhere as long as you have an Andrew user ID and Password.  Maybe the problem was that he was logging in with "his" WoS psswd.  To be authenticated, he needs to login with his Andrew user ID and psswd and then sign in if he's registered on WoS.13:06PM 89054923290093542788026015@web.libraryh3lp.com: Alright.   I will pass this information along and see if it solves his problem.   Thank you for your help.13:06PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You're welcome.13:07PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: He can also email us directly if that will help huntref@andrew.cmu.edu13:08PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: But basically he'll get a login prompt for his Andrew user ID and psswd if not on a CMU IP address.  Once in WoS, he can login to use the special features (saved searches, etc.), assuming he registered to use them and that's what he means by loggin in with his WoS ID and psswd.

14:15PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi!14:15PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi14:15PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: I am Jaya, first year MBA Student.14:15PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi Jaya-what can I help you with?14:15PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: I need to borrow a book.14:15PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: But i don't know how to do it.14:15PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: Could you please help me!14:15PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Sure.14:17PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: First you need to search our catalog to see if we have the book.  The easiest way to do that might be to use our advanced search.  Our homepage, with the catalog in simple search is www.library.cmu.edu and here's the link to the advanced search  http://vufind.library.cmu.edu/vufind/Search/Advanced (more to come)14:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Once you find the record for the book and see that it is available, you come into the library and retrieve the book.  Take the book, with your CMU ID card to the circulation desk on the 1st floor and they will charge (check out) the book to you.  You'll be give a date the book is due back (more to come)14:18PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: Can i reserve the book?14:18PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: and collect it later14:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If we don't have the book, then you can use either EZ Borrow or interlibrary loan to get a copy of the book -here's the link for those services.  http://www.library.cmu.edu/using/requesting14:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: no, our books are first come first serve, so if it is available, you cannot reserve it. 14:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: However, if it is checked out, you can put a hold on it14:20PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: What does Hold means?14:21PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: That means the person who has the book is told to bring the book in because someone else wants it.  They get to have it for 7 days, then must bring it back so the person who wants it (who placed the hold) can get it. When it comes back the person who put the hold on it is notified it is available.14:27PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: Thanks!14:27PM 60447273933273885439250798@web.libraryh3lp.com: Have a nice day14:27PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You're very welcome! :-) 14:27PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You have a good day as well!

09:22AM 95252015094697582134702334@web.libraryh3lp.com: Good Morning,I donŠ—Èt know if IŠ—Èm an Š—“eligibleŠ— questioner. IŠ—Èm a film maker in the U.K. with an interesting copyright conundrum.I was looking at using the instrumental of Š—…Jitterbug WaltzŠ—È by Fats Waller. It was written in 1942 by Waller who died in 1943. Warner Chappell publishes in US and Sony ATV claim major territories ROW. ItŠ—Ès still in copyright in the U.S. However collection societies world wide (outside the U.S.) so far as I can see, show the work as public domain.Sony are saying that, because itŠ—Ès an original U.S. copyright they believe it is subject to U.S. copyright laws and therefore still in copyright outside the U.S. However they arenŠ—Èt 100% sure. There are a number of unanswered questions. Some relate to how and when Sony acquired the copyright such as Š—– was the copyright acquired through the ATV purchase and possibly subject to U.K. copyright periodŠ—_ and some are matters of law such as - are copyrights published outside the U.S. by a different publisher to the one in the U.S. (even if that publisher is currently U.S. based) subject to the of the 1998 Copyright Term Extension Act?Sony is being slow in coming back. I suspect that the question is beyond most of their younger employees and is being pushed from desk to desk but no one is picking it up because itŠ—Ès a thorny problem and publishers instinctively donŠ—Èt like to lose control of anything.(To complicate it further there are claims in the British Reversionary Territories as well but I think thatŠ—Ès one for another day).Any help would be greatly appreciated. For me itŠ—Ès become as much a question of copyright in general as specific to the particular title.09:22AM 95252015094697582134702334@web.libraryh3lp.com: Peter09:23AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi-09:23AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Let me read your question09:23AM 95252015094697582134702334@web.libraryh3lp.com: Above was all neatly paragraphed for clarity but now all smooshed together. Peter09:25AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Sorry, but this is really beyond the scope of our chat service.  09:25AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It really seems to be a question for a copyright lawyer, which we are not.  We can refer you to some copyright websites in the US if that would help.09:26AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: https://www.copyright.gov/title17/09:26AM 95252015094697582134702334@web.libraryh3lp.com: Thanks09:26AM 95252015094697582134702334@web.libraryh3lp.com: Please do09:26AM 95252015094697582134702334@web.libraryh3lp.com: I was googling and your website demonstrated that CM had the expertise so I thought IŠ—Èd fire something off to you. 09:29AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Our chat service is intended for our immediate community, for the more simple questions.  Complex ones we'd refer to the librarian for that subject area.  We don't however, have a copyright librarian, though we do have lawyers on campus for CMU students and faculty. Not all of our databases provide links to full text.  If there is no full text right under the article, there is usually and Icon (sometimes called Get It, sometimes just called find html/pdf that you can click on to see if the full text is in another one of our databases.12:42PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: And if you don't see it, you can always go to our list of ejournals http://www.library.cmu.edu/find/eJournals to see if we have it. So what you can do now is use our interlibrary loan service. 12:42PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: http://www.library.cmu.edu/using/requesting  12:42PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Register, fill out a form and we'll find a library that has it and get a copy for you. This is at the bottom of the record at the University of Aukland: Restricted Item. Print thesis available in the University of Auckland Library or may be available through Interlibrary Loan.11:44AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If your husband belongs to researchgate, (sort of like linked in, where you can post articles, etec.)  they seem to have a link to a PDF, but not sure how much is on there.11:45AM 37791827348186775134817076@web.libraryh3lp.com: Can we access researchgate or do you need subscription for that?11:45AM 37791827348186775134817076@web.libraryh3lp.com: PDF is what he would like 11:45AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You just need to sign up.  I searched the title and basically it now says it will send an email to the author asking for the work.11:46AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: So it's not a PDF, they will send email to author: Do you want to send this request to the author?The authors of this publication aren't on ResearchGate yet. To help you get thefull-text faster, requests will be sent to them by email:11:46AM 37791827348186775134817076@web.libraryh3lp.com: oh that will be fine.  And the best and easiest way to get the information.11:47AM 37791827348186775134817076@web.libraryh3lp.com: So do I click on the authors name for the email?11:48AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: let me just check worldcat to see if any us library has it.  As for clicking-I guess so, I've never done a request like that before either!11:48AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: No US library has this, only the University of Aukland and the University of New South Wales, so I'd go the author route.11:49AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: So I'd suggestjoinging Researchgate, search for the title, then when it asks if you want to sent the request via email to the author click yes.  11:50AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Otherwise, your only option is ILL and of course we will do ILL with New Zealand. It will just take time.11:50AM 37791827348186775134817076@web.libraryh3lp.com: Ok thank you so much.  11:50AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You're welcome, Prema.11:50AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Take care.11:50AM 37791827348186775134817076@web.libraryh3lp.com: That was very helpful. I think I have found it as well. Sometimes the "full text" results within some of the ProQuest results are a bit tricky. In this case this looks to be a post from a blog that has been provided through ProQuest.10:07AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: This is often the case with market research reports in ProQuest as well. They end up being advertisements for the reports or in this case a blog, but the actual report is not available.10:07AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It is more of a press release announcing it in a way.10:08AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Are you with the Tepper School by chance?10:08AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: yes10:08AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay, are you interested in the biometrics market?10:08AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: yes, i am interested in voice biometrics market 10:09AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay, I can lead you to some comparable resources that we have that may yield some helpful results.10:09AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: great, thank you so much10:09AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I am the business librarian by the way. My name is Ryan Splenda :)10:10AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: my pleasure!10:10AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: nice to meet you. thank you for your help10:10AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Nice to meet you as well :)10:10AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay, so I have created a research guide on Market Research that can be accessed here: http://guides.library.cmu.edu/marketresearch10:10AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: On this page are all of the resources that we have that may be helpful.10:11AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Since you are looking at biometrics, I would suggest the following databases for reports: BCC Research and Frost & Sullivan for sure.10:12AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: There is a possibility that something might show up within Gartner and IBISWorld, but it may be a bit leaner than the previosu two mentioned10:12AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: For example, I did a quick search in BCC Research and found a report called "Biometrics: Technologies and Global Markets" that may be of interest10:13AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You can fully download the reports in most of these resources, except for Frost & Sullivan (unfortunately we only have read-only access to their content). BUT, if you find a report of interest and want the PDF, I have a way of getting those for you.10:15AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: yes, I find lots of article there. thank you so much10:15AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: so bcc % frost10:15AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: &10:15AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You are welcome!10:16AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: my name is henry. Thank you for your kindness. 10:16AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Pleasure to meet you, Henry! And it's my pleasure.10:16AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Also10:17AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: if all else fails, consider the trade publication route. Many times industry professionals will publish articles on niche industries, products and services, and company info in these publications for other industry professionals.10:18AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: The main resource to consider for this is: Business Source Complete (also located on that guide under the "News sources on markets, industries" section)10:18AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: understand10:19AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Awesome! Is there anything else that I can help with today?10:19AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: no, thank you for your time and kindness.10:20AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You are most welcome! Good luck with everything :)10:20AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If you need to reach me again, my email is rsplenda@andrew.cmu.edu10:20AM 95068837384843860488317461@web.libraryh3lp.com: great! have a good day. byebye!10:21AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Bye! :)

09:25AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi, I was wondering if I could get help on some research I'm doing!09:25AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi!09:25AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: How may I help?09:26AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: So I'm doing my thesis on fixed exchange rate regimes, and part of my thesis specifically centers on EDA of those countries before and after either fixing the values of their currency or dollarizing.09:27AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: I was able to find the list of countries that currently are in those regimes via the IMF's report, but I have been looking everywhere and am struggling to find the years that these countries change over from floating exchange rates to fixed exchange rates09:27AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: I was wondering if there is a certain place I should be looking?09:28AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay, sounds like some interesting research that you are working on09:28AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Are you, by chance, a  Tepper student?09:28AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yes, I am!09:29AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Wonderful! My name is Ryan and I am the liaison librarian to the Tepper School. Pleasure to meet you :)09:29AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: Awesome!! Nice to meet you too :) My name is Vaasavi.09:29AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: :)09:30AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: So, you were able to find the list of countries that changed to fixed exchange rates in an IMF report?09:30AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: And you need to figure out when they changed over?09:31AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yeah, I was. If you'd like, I can either link you the report itself, or send you over the list of countries09:31AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: That would be great! I was going to ask about the IMF report and if I can see it.09:31AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: http://www.imf.org/external/pubs/nft/2014/areaers/ar2014.pdf09:32AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I'm thinking that there may not be a one-stop solution to finding out this information.09:32AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: Page four is what I'm using; specifically looking at exchange rate anchors but stopping at the stabilized arrangement; crawling peg is not what I want09:34AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay. Have you found that the fixed exchange rate is set up or determined by a larger body or organization? Or is this done more on an individual government basis?09:35AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Forgive me, this isn't exactly my area of expertise :)09:35AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: It depends. So the bolded acronyms are names of currency unions--those would be larger bodies that determine the fixed rates. Otherwise, it happens on an individual government basis09:35AM 27925966226547648934045883@web.libraryh3lp.com: And no worries, it's not even my thesis advisor's expertise haha09:37AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay, lol. 15:07PM 05837271062410507185354855@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi, this is Geonu Kim, a phd candidate of MSE. I want to ask questions about requesting items. Now I research contact lens materials, and find that "Contact lens practice" (3rd edition, Author: Nathan Efron) is a great book for me. How can I request this item? Should I use ILLiad or E-Z Borrow?15:07PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi Geonu!15:08PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Thanks for contacting us with your question15:08PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You have already double-checked to make sure that we don't have this book already?15:10PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay, I have checked our holdings and it looks like we do not have it15:11PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: E-Z Borrow would potentially get you the book faster as it searches Pennsylvania institutions for this book15:11PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You would log into E-Z Borrow, search for the book, and place the request15:11PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: This can be done here: http://library.cmu.edu/using/requesting15:12PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: ILLiad would take a little longer because we would do the searching for you across the country and try to get the book to you that way15:12PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You would also log into ILLiad, fill out a form with citation information for the book and place the request that way15:16PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: The same link has ILLiad information15:17PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Are you still there, Geonu?15:20PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Additionally, you may want to reach out to the Liaison Librarian for MSE to see if she could possibly add the book to our collection.15:20PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Her name is Donna Beck, and her contact info is here: http://library.cmu.edu/about/people/donna-beck15:20PM 05837271062410507185354855@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi I am here okay If E-Z borrow does not work. I will contact with her 15:29PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Sounds good15:29PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: THanks for contacting us!

16:31PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hello16:31PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi, how can I help you?16:31PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: I am Karandeep Bajaj and will be joining CMU this fall16:32PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Great to hear!16:32PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: I wanted to ask about the book borrowing process16:32PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: I'm a MSE student16:33PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: So for example I want to borrow "Concurrency: State Models and Java Programs" by Magee and Kramer 16:33PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: So can you tell me the process ?16:33PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Sure, are you on the Pittsburgh campus or at the Silicon Valley Campus?16:34PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: Pittsburgh16:35PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay, are you able to find the record for the book in our catalog?16:35PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yes16:36PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Great, the record indicates that this book is in our Engineering & Science Library.  That's the Sorrell's Engineering & Science Library on the fourth floor of Wean Hall.16:37PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Our printed books are all in one area within the library...16:37PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: ok16:37PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You'll use the call number "QA76.642 .M34 2006" to find the book on the shelf.16:38PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Then, you can take the book to the front service desk and they'll check it out to you.  If you're not in the system yet, they can put you in the system.16:39PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: okay16:39PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Here is some general information about borrowing and renewing that I think will help:  http://www.library.cmu.edu/using/borrow/who16:40PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: okay thanks16:40PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: Just few more questions16:40PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Sure!16:40PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: How many books at a time ?16:40PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: 100 ?16:40PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: As a graduate student, yes ... it's 100 at a time.16:41PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Most people borrow far fewer items, but for doctoral students ... well, we don't want anything to slow them down.16:41PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: okay makes sense16:42PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: For how long can i keep a book?16:42PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It's important to note that a borrowed book is subject to a recall if the person had had it for one week and someone else needs to use it.16:42PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: 90 days ?16:42PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: That's correct.  You get one online renewal.16:42PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: For a total of 180 days.  Then we make sure you can actually still locate it by asking you to bring it back.16:43PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If nobody else has a hold on it, the process can start again for 180 days.16:44PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: Suppose I have loaned a book and after a week somebody else also requests a book. So in that case i need to return it ASAP or after 90 days ?16:44PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Current course textbooks are a problem though.  We try to keep a copy or two to circulate within the library, but that's all.  We really try to collect in digital format now - that goes for all science & engineering books.16:45PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You'd need to return it as soon as practical.16:46PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You could place a hold on it as well - getting it back in about a week and a half.16:46PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If a book is too popular, we will explore getting a second print copy or, more preferably, a digital version.16:47PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Your best person to reach out to with a problem like that will be your liaison librarian.16:48PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: See:  http://www.library.cmu.edu/research/expert16:49PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: How does a student get to read a digital version of a book ?16:49PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Help me out ... MSE ... would that be part of the ECE Department, SCS ... or Heinz College these days?16:49PM 08832900459003042458367216@web.libraryh3lp.com: MSE is a part of SCS16:50PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay ... your liaison librarian is Jillian Chisnell Miller.16:50PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: To get a digital version of a book ...16:50PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Many will be found in our catalog via our library's main web site.16:51PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: However, the world of e-books is kind of messy right now ...16:52PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: So, you'll also want to use our"Articles & More" search to e-books that are available to you ...16:52PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Plus, some might be identified in the research database known as JSTOR.16:53PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If you're uncertain, feel free to ask us via whatever means is most convenient. Your request goes on the bottom of our pile, then on the bottom of lending library.  You can see progress/process in your ILLiad account.11:16AM 51592010858137564281462646@web.libraryh3lp.com: OK11:16AM 51592010858137564281462646@web.libraryh3lp.com: Just want to know if the book is available somewhere... if it's not, I'll have to see how to get it11:16AM 51592010858137564281462646@web.libraryh3lp.com: How does CMU decides which books to buy?11:17AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Usually a book is available "somewhere."  If you use the Worldcat database (on our homepage, under search and find, research databases)11:18AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Each department/school on campus has a librarian who is responsible for buying books, answering in depth research questions, teaching classes on important resources in that field, etc.  if you tell me what dept./school you are in, I'll send you the name of your librarian and you can suggest a title to that person.11:19AM 51592010858137564281462646@web.libraryh3lp.com: I'm in the Department of Engineering and Public Policy11:20AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Well you are in luck-I am your librarian, Sue Collins.  Epp acutally has 2, one for the engineering part (Lynn Berard), and I do the policy, etc. part.11:21AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: This 2 vols set is $259 dollars-do you want paper or e-version?

13:05PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi, my name is Alex I am doing a research project for my English class 76-101 and am having difficultly finding articles on a particular subject. 13:05PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: hi alex13:06PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: This is Ethan .. what are you looking for?13:07PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: I am looking for anything arguing that Shakespeare is over analyzed but specifically that the Witches in Macbeth are, I am not sure if books or articles on this topic just dont exist or I'm doing something wrong13:08PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: well .. which section is this? who is your instructor?  this will help me figure out what the focus of the class is13:09PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: My professor is Bowman I am in section F it is about Macbeth 13:10PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: One of the issues you have is that your "topic" is not really a topic or a question per se .. to figure out this, you'd have to "count" how much has been written .. I just don't know that someone would write a scholarly article about this.13:11PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Have you run this across professor Bowman?  To see if you could approach it differently?13:11PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: For example, I can certainly help you find articles that analyzed Macbeth13:12PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: one thing you might be able to do is to see if all the analysis centers around the same theme .. but that's going to be a huge topic for the purpose of your class (since you have to exhaust everything out there).13:13PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yeah I understand, I talked to her but havent told her yet that I can't find articles to support my claim yet, I might need to adjust it, I was looking for evidence to support it isnt of just cite a bunch of arguments that do what I'm arguing against 13:14PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: But yeah I understand not a lot people would argue against analyzing it I was just hoping I was searching wrong 13:14PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Ok, but what are you building your argument on?  Why do you think that it has been over analyzed?  What evidence or research do you have from what you've read?13:16PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: We have course readings for our class by Bloom and Bristol for example that make their own argument by using the Witches and their importance in Macbeth, but stretch it a lot, I'm arguing that by doing this they are taking away from the actual meaning of Macbeth 13:17PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: But so far my arguments center around showing how these other authors stretch meanings and over analyze things to support their own claims, I would like something that supports my claim as well13:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: ah .. ok .. now we're getting somewhere .. 13:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: A better approach would be to look at how it is analyzed and see if there are other authors argued their representations13:19PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: ah ok 13:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: so .. what databases have you used?13:20PM 15956205066895652675771011@web.libraryh3lp.com: Can I continue this disscussion over email? 12:10PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi!12:10PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: hi12:11PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: How can I find an index of Secretary George P. Shultz congressional testimonies12:11PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: or at least for the ones we have on proquest12:12PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I'm not sure what you mean by index.  If he testified in Congress, it would be in Proquest Congressional, which can be searched in a number of ways.  12:12PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: okay. what would be the best way?12:12PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: I have been just typing congressional testimony George P. Shultz12:16PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: In Proquest Congressional, in the advanced search, you can select witness as the field and then enter the witness name.12:17PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: let me look into this a little more12:18PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: I see. Thank you. But I'm looking for him as a speaker12:19PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: OK-I need some clarification.  Do you want him as a witness in hearings before Congress?12:21PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: no. not as witness12:27PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: The Congressional Record is what is said on the floor of Congress (with cngressmen being able to edit remarks later). Other than that, there are hearings, with where people give testimony as witnesses before Congressional committees.12:34PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: okay, thanks!12:35PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: Let me review it, and I'll get back to you with better questions12:35PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: We have access to both.12:35PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: I'm really confused!12:35PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It's complicated, so it's important to know what it is you want-what are you working on?12:36PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: I am tracking Secretary Shultz speeches12:36PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: that would include his speeches before congress12:39PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It might be helpful to look at a biography or two of Shultz-it's possible there might be some info in the bibliographies about this.12:39PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: thank you12:40PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: we have this: BOOKAvailableTurmoil and triumph : my years as secretary of stateby Shultz, George Pratt, 1920- Published 1993Subjects: Š—“...Shultz, George Pratt, 1920-...Š—Located: Hunt Library - STACKS-2 (Stacks 2nd Floor) Call Number: E840.8 .S535 A3 199312:40PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You don't have to read the whole book-look at the table of contents, index, and any special lists of info in the back.  12:41PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: ok!12:41PM 68214992810609241431091019@web.libraryh3lp.com: thanks, that was very helpful

12:17PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hello, May I get some help on finding time line of major business or tech events from google and corresponding stock rise and fall?12:17PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi12:17PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Thank you! This is my final project for a business course, but I'm an engineering student with almost zero background in this area 12:17PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Thanks for contacting us12:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: No problem at all. I am the Business Librarian and can help12:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Probably the best way to go about this is from a company resources perspective12:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Let me introduce you to a guide that I have created on company research: http://guides.library.cmu.edu/companies12:19PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Great! I searched for such information on Google and something like this would be great, but all the time lines I found a pretty old and only goes until 201112:20PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: No problem. You will probably have to piece together a couple of different resources in order to complete your timeline12:20PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I don't think that we have one resource that will cover both in one swoop12:20PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: On that guide, take a look at the "Company Financials" box12:21PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: There is a resource listed there called Mergent Online12:21PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: select that resource12:23PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: This looks great, the info here is pretty up to date12:23PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Once in it type in Alphabet in the search box (because they recently restructured and that is the name of the ultimate parent company now)12:23PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Oh great! You got in and found Google/Alphabet?12:24PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Click on the "Equity Pricing" tab and you can get to current and historical stock pricing data12:24PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yes12:24PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You can even export this data into excel using the "Report" sub tab12:26PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Is there a place that I can find major events? I wish to see the link between the stock change and Google's events, such as the Cloud Next conference last week and the release of Google phone pixel several months ago12:27PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Okay. The same database has a "News" tab as well, but it may not go back as far as you'd like it too.12:28PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Yes, I wish to see some major events maybe range for the whole year of Google12:28PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: There is a sub-section within that tab called historical news that gives you some more info12:29PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Also on the main "Company Details" tab again, there is a section down at the bottom of that page that gives "Company News and Corporate Events"12:30PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: There is a second database to consider for news as well though12:31PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: The historial news is about acquisitions, would there be some resource for major business events, product release, change in market structure and major players?12:31PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: We may have to go the news database route for this.12:32PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Take a look at the "News Sources and Research Articles" box within the guide and click on the Business Source Premier databae12:34PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: We can search this database for Google/Alphabet  as a "Company Entity" and then narrow by publication types after that12:35PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: This is just another potential place to find news because this database has access to newspapers, magazines, and trade publications all from the business discipline12:37PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Is there a tab for "Company Entity"?12:37PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: There is a drop down search filter for company entity12:38PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: next to the search box itself. It defaults to "Select Field Optional" but can be changed12:38PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: You could also change that drop down to "Ticker Symbol" as well if you'd like12:39PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It looke like company entity is more reliable though12:39PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: looks*12:40PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: If you do go the ticker route, use their old ticker GOOG instead of the new one GOOGL12:40PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Thank you very much!12:40PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: No problem!12:40PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: One last suggestion if you'd like12:41PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Actually, before that...notice that there are additional limiters on the left-hand side of the page within Business Source Premier that you can use to further narrow your search results.12:42PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: For example, Date range, publication type (news vs. trade publication, etc.)12:46PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Is trade publication mainly focusing on the finance?12:46PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It depends, it could focus on quite a few different aspects 12:47PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: They mainly focus on the different industry(ies) that your company of interest operates within12:47PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: But this would be where you could get some nitty gritty info on major events that have happened with Google12:48PM 67597530406307812272236012@web.libraryh3lp.com: Thank you! Have a nice afternoon!

10:36AM 25138304805956194778771730@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hello, I'm trying to use the Library resources to research companies 10:36AM 25138304805956194778771730@web.libraryh3lp.com: I was wondering if there's a database for startups 10:36AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Hi!10:36AM 25138304805956194778771730@web.libraryh3lp.com: like Crunchbase or something similar that the library subscribes to 10:37AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Yes, we have some resources that could be helpful when trying to find information on startups10:38AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Let me direct you to a guide that I've created on company research10:38AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: http://guides.library.cmu.edu/companies10:38AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Within this guide there are a couple of database to consider.10:39AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Since you are focusing on startups, the best resource to use is probably PrivCo. It is listed int he "Company Basics" box10:39AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: It does require an account set up using your CMU credentials, but this is one of the premier resources that we have for private companies (since most, if not all, startups are private).10:40AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: There are some other databases in this guide that may have very basic information on private/startup companies as well. They are Hoover's, ReferenceUSA, and to some degree Mergent Online10:41AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Are you mainly looking for basic information on startups?10:45AM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I also forgot to mention that downloading/exporting in PrivCo is allowed, but there is a monthly limit. It does reset each month. 15:01PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: Hi15:01PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: how may I help you15:02PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: How can I find an article based on the name of the author?15:02PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: you can search an article by the authors name how are you searching15:04PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: I have used the search box here and I have used the advanced search on ebsco host also15:05PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: however, I want to find a study published by Donald Hebb in the American Psychologist and his name is not in the title of the study15:06PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: As such where can I put in the name of the author in the advanced search?15:06PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: one moment let me check15:13PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: still checking 15:13PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: ok15:16PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: hi15:16PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: hello15:16PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I understand you're looking for an article by donald hebb?15:17PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: yes, I know its been published in the journal American Psychologist in 1957 but I still can't find it15:17PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: where did you get this information?15:18PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: I got this information from the Carnegie Skills Workshop Professor15:18PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Well, let me look. (PsycINFO Database Record (c) 2012 APA, all rights reserved)15:32PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: Its alright, I will check it out15:32PM 47872567397237799123301544@web.libraryh3lp.com: Thank you very much15:33PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Ok-but just an FYI couldn't find any 1957 article by Hebb. A bicycle is a non-motorized, man-powered vehicle with pedals and two wheels attached to a frame. Similar to motorcycles, many different types of bicycles exist, such as mountain, hybrid, road, racing and touring bicycles. Bicycle parts sold by the industry include bike frames, drive trains, handlebars, seats and brakes. Many local governments also require features such as lamps, reflectors or warning bells.Over the five years to 2016, sales of bicycles and related parts have risen. Increased health consciousness by consumers have led to rising use of bicycles over the period. According to the Bicycle League, from 2000, bicycle commuting rates have risen by 62.0% in bicycle commuting as more people are biking to work as a way to stay in shape and avoid transportation costs.16:38PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Lots of repeat information.  16:39PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: Let me try another database.16:41PM askandyver2@chat.libraryh3lp.com: I wasn't thinking of high technology.
